title: The 14 Best Makeup Gift Sets You’ll Want to Keep for Yourself
description: Major savings on Hourglass, Merit, Charlotte Tilbury and more.
excerpt: We found the best makeup gift sets, including unique gift sets, the best luxury makeup sets, and great travel gift sets.
text: 1Best for a Full FaceHourglass The Full Face Edit SetConsMay not be suitable for every skin toneHourglass’s holiday gift set is truly a treat. It comes with five full-size hero products, including glitter eyeshadow, an all-purpose face brush, and one of the Ambient Lighting Unlocked Palettes the brand debuted earlier this year. Also included is a large makeup bag to hold all the products and the rest of your everyday makeup routine.Includes: Face palette, face brush, mascara, single eyeshadow, makeup bagValue: $333Nordstrom rating: 4.3/5 starsAn ELLE editor says: “Hourglass is hands down one of my top makeup brands of all time. Every single formula I’ve tried from its collections has become a fast favorite, and I’m always excited to see the brand’s new holiday palettes each year. When used together, all of the shades melt into the skin and give it a soft, glowy finish that looks like a real-life filter. Another standout in this kit is the glitter eyeshadow. I don’t think I’ve ever not gotten a compliment while wearing one of the shades. Plus, considering the chic faux-leather makeup bag that comes with this set, I may just have to gift one to myself.”—Carol Lee, ELLE.com associate beauty e-commerce writer2Best Lipstick SetMerit The Dress Code SetConsShades are limited-editionMerit lipstick enthusiasts, listen up! This set includes three new limited-edition shades and a limited-edition formula meant to tint your lips with a wash of color. The other lipsticks have a nourishing satin finish and a soft matte one in gorgeous hues great for fall, the holidays, and beyond. Includes: 3 lipsticksValue: $76An ELLE editor says: “If I could only wear one brand of lipstick for the rest of my life, it would be Merit. The formulas are exactly what I want them to be (nourishing, non-drying, the perfect balance of pigment), and it’s like Merit pulled the shades right off of a ‘90s Pinterest board. This set has been calling my name since the first time I saw it, and the fact that it includes a new formula and shade is the cherry on top.”—Carol LeeAdvertisement - Continue Reading Below3Best LuxuryDior Lip and Cheek Pink Glow Ritual SetProsContains two full-size productsConsOnly one shade optionIn case you missed it, TikTok has helped make Dior’s Addict Lip Glow Oil and Rosy Glow Blush two of the most covetable luxury makeup items on the market. This set features both of the viral products and a Dior makeup bag—who could resist?Includes: Blush, lip oil Sephora rating: 3/5 starsAn ELLE editor says: “If I wanted to introduce someone to the magic of Dior makeup, this set would be my pick. It contains two of the most popular products, and both formulas have blown me away in the past. The bright pink blush transforms into a flattering flush on my cheeks, while the lip oil feels so plush on my lips and makes my pout look as juicy as a peach.”—Carol Lee4Best TikTok-FamousCharlotte Tilbury Pillow Talk Lip and Cheek Secrets SetProsProducts are cruelty-freeConsOnly one full-size itemWhether you’ve been curious about these products or want a travel-sized version to take with you on your adventures, this makeup set is an ideal opportunity to try a few viral products from Charlotte Tilbury. Apply all of them at once, and you’ll end up with a glamorous, high-shine finish nobody will be able to look away from.Includes: Travel-size bronzer, travel-size highlighter, travel-size lipstick, lip glossValue: $75Sephora rating: 3.3/5 starsAn ELLE editor says: “I have to admit that I totally bought into the hype of Charlotte Tilbury’s Pillow Talk range—and I’m glad I did. Every time I wear the products, I feel like they help me create a look fit for a sexy yet demure princess. The Beauty Light Wands, in particular, have lived up to their reputation—they blend in like a dream and make my cheeks look incredibly glowy under all lighting conditions.”—Carol LeeAdvertisement - Continue Reading Below5Best Lip Oil SetSaie Glossybounce Lip Gloss Oil DuoConsShades may not appear as pigmented on all skin tonesWe all know and love Saie for its nourishing, high-performance products, and the Glossybounce Lip Gloss Oil is a true winner. Each tube has an infusion of hyaluronic acid, jojoba oil, and shea butter to moisturize and plump your pout. This set includes fan-favorite shade Kiss, a pinky nude, and a new limited-edition one called Crush, a bright blue-red.Includes: 2 lip oilsValue: $44An ELLE editor says: “I’ve spoken about this a million times by now, but my one true makeup nemesis is a sticky, gooey lip gloss. I just can’t stand the sensation. Even if they look incredible, I find myself wiping sticky lip glosses off after a few tortured minutes. Discovering the lip oil from Saie was a huge relief because it feels like a nourishing, non-sticky lip balm, but it shines like a gloss.”—Carol Lee6Best Lip Gloss SetFenty Beauty by Rihanna The Gloss Bomb VaultProsIncludes a variety of gloss formulasConsSome may dislike scentThis option from Fenty features ten gorgeous shades of one of the brand’s most beloved products, the Gloss Bomb, in three different formulas: Universal Lip Luminizer, Heat Universal Lip Luminizer + Plumper, and Ice Cooling Lip Luminizer. It’s a mix of classic tried-and-true hues and new ones that you can only get in this set. If you haven’t tried any of Fenty’s glosses or only have the original, Fenty Glow, this may be your sign to splurge and try the many other shades the brand offers.Includes: 10 lip glosses Value: $235An ELLE editor says: “Fenty’s lip glosses were one of the first non-drugstore options I ever tried and fell in love with. I’m still mesmerized by just how shiny my lips look when I have one on that I swear that I can almost see my reflection in them.”—Carol LeeAdvertisement - Continue Reading Below7Best Makeup Pencil SetMake Up For Ever Mini Artist Color Pencil Lipliner & Eyeliner KitProsPencils are long-lastingConsDoes not include sharpenerThe beauty of Make Up For Ever’s Artist Color Pencils is that you can pretty much use them anywhere on your face, including your eyes and your lips. In a pinch, you can even contour or add some color to your cheeks and eyes with them. This set has five mini versions you can slip into your purse for when you’re on-the-go so you’ll always be prepared.Includes: 5 mini lip and eye pencilsValue: $60Sephora rating: 5/5 starsAn ELLE editor says: “If you have as many lip liners as I do, it takes a while to get through one. But even if you don’t these will last you a while because they’re so long-lasting and a little goes a long way. Waxier formulas like this one have a tenacity that softer formulas sometimes don’t have, and Make Up For Ever lip liners have stuck with me through 12-hour work days, greasy meals, and countless sips of water.”—Carol Lee8Best Setting Spray Value SetUrban Decay Seeing Double All Nighter Waterproof Setting SprayThe holidays are always the best time to stock up on this crowd pleasing product, which has been a classic for years. It’s a tried-and-true product that paved the way for the setting spray category and significantly extends the weartime of your makeup for up to 16 hours. Includes: 2 setting spraysValue: $72An ELLE editor says: “I’m not the biggest setting spray girl, but when I’m facing an especially humid day or anticipating a special occasion that involves lots of pictures, I rely on this one to keep everything in place. I think I’ve had at least one bottle in my stash for about a decade now.”—Carol LeeAdvertisement - Continue Reading Below9Best Clean Makeup SetIris & Romeo Signature Glow EssentialsLoved ones who are especially ingredient-conscious will appreciate this set from Iris & Romeo, which formulates its high-performing cosmetics without any of the thousands of ingredients banned by the stricter European Union guidelines. The set includes a full-size tinted SPF, a ceramide-infused tint for lips and cheeks, and a curling and volumizing mascara that boosts lash health using peptides.Includes: Tinted SPF, lip and cheek balm, mini mascara, makeup bagValue: $94An ELLE editor says: “If I were to only wear three makeup products, they’d be mascara, eyebrow pencil, and concealer. And I wear quite a lot of mascara—I’m talking three to five layers every time I apply makeup. In my eyes, lashes should be lengthened, curled, and beefed up as much as possible, and the darker the mascara, the better. Brown mascara may be trending these days, but as someone with naturally black hair, I can’t give up my deep black mascara. Iris & Romeo’s signature mascara is currently my absolute favorite because it fits all of my criteria, and it doesn’t smudge all over my under eyes, either. The brush wand curls my lashes sans lash curler, and the formula builds upon itself to give me falsie-like lashes that attract compliments wherever I go. While I haven’t tried the brand’s other products, the mascara is so good that I’m eager to try the rest of the line, and so I might just have to purchase this set for my own stocking.”10Best Mini Cheek SetRare Beauty Mini Blush and Luminize TrioWhether you’re a Rare Beauty collector or have yet to dip your toe into the world of Selena Gomez’s beauty line, this mini set is here to introduce you to two never-before-seen cheek shades: a Positive Light Liquid Luminizer in the exclusive shade Enliven, a peachy shade with gold shimmer, and Beloved, a soft brick red. You’ll also find Virtue, a popular neutral peach blush, in the box. A little truly goes a long way with these gems, so even the mini sizes will last you much longer than you think.Includes: Liquid highlighter, 2 mini blushesValue: $44Sephora rating: 4.7/5 starsA Sephora reviewer says: “This was my first attempt at Rare blushes, and I’m loving the quality. First of all, these colors are perfect for my medium/tan skin tone, adding an interesting touch that lights up any makeup. Also, although these are mini versions, I feel there’s a nice amount of product in them. I would recommend 100 percent.”Advertisement - Continue Reading Below11Best Primer SetMilk Makeup Mini Hydro Grip Primer Pre-Game Pack SetRecently, Milk Makeup’s viral Hydro Grip Primer welcomed a new sibling; just like its predecessor, the Hydro Grip + Glow Primer helps makeup adhere to the face and lock in place, but it also bestows upon the skin a sheer golden glow. Want to try both? You’re in luck—this set comes with a mini version of each version, so you can have each one on hand while you decide on which one you like best. Includes: 2 mini primersValue: $40Sephora rating: 5/5 starsA Sephora reviewer says: “I could not wait to get to try these primers. They both work fantastic.”12Best Lip ComboRefy Plum Lip Liner and Gloss CollectionMove over, Coca-Cola lips—it’s time for juicy plum pouts to shine. Refy has debuted a limited-edition lip duo that fits perfectly with both our moody fall and festive holiday mood boards. Wear the liner on its own for a blurred, matte finish or add the lip gloss on top to make your lips resemble the most stunning stained glass. Includes: Lip liner, lip glossValue: $44Sephora rating: 4.3/5 starsA Sephora reviewer says: “This combo is *stellar*! The plum is a perfect fall color. The blur liner is so easy to use, and the gloss has great pigment and is not sticky. So good!”Advertisement - Continue Reading Below13Best Eyeshadow PaletteDanessa Myricks Beauty Lightwork VI The Freedom PaletteProsCompatible with all other Danessa Myricks palettesConsOne reviewer noted that a pan fell out on its ownAs you can see, this product is basically three palettes in one and contains all of the metallic, shimmery, and duo-chrome shades you might ever need. Here’s a little secret: The magnetic label on the cover of the palette has a mirror on the other side. Plus, you can remove one of the three mini palettes inside the larger case and place the label on top to just take one section with you while traveling. As if that wasn’t enough, the pans are compatible with the brand’s other square-pan palettes, so you can switch out some of the shades as needed. Danessa Myricks never ceases to amaze us.Includes: 18-pan palette Sephora rating: 4.8/5 starsA Sephora reviewer says: “This palette is so much fun. The images online don’t do it justice. Even in the pan, you don’t always see how multi-dimensional these shadows are. On the eyes? Gorgeous! I’m having so much fun playing with this palette. The actual functionality of the palette is so cool, too. Love that you can change the size and configuration.”14Best Tinted Lip Balm SetSummer Fridays The Holiday Lip Butter Balm SetProsCurved applicator hugs lipsConsSome may dislike scentsSummer Fridays’s lip balms are social media-famous for a reason—their seed butter-rich formulas instantly cure flakiness and dryness, and they come in a variety of flattering shades. This trio has clear, pink, and red lip butters. If you look at the price of the set, you’re “basically getting a balm for free,” as one reviewer pointed out.Includes: 3 lip balmsValue: $72Sephora rating: 5/5 starsA Sephora reviewer says: “I was on the fence because I own so many lip things at the moment. Just add it to your cart, because it’s so worth it. I love all the scents, and you are getting so much. It will last you awhile. Treat yourself.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowWhy Trust ELLE BeautyAs a leading publisher of fashion, lifestyle, and beauty content, ELLE.com is committed to highlighting the best products in various categories by personally testing the latest and most innovative products, interviewing countless experts, and vetting customer-loved items. For this piece, beauty writer Carol Lee combed through the internet for top-rated options for makeup gift sets, assessing each one based on their features and customer evaluations.Carol Lee is the Associate Beauty E-Commerce Writer at ELLE.com, where she covers all things beauty and personal care. Before joining the team, she was an editor at Food Network Magazine and HGTV Magazine and ran the beauty section at The Pioneer Woman. Carol received her bachelor’s degree in Journalism from New York University and was one of the first customers to visit Glossier’s flagship store in New York’s Soho neighborhood. Over the years, she’s tested countless makeup, hair, and skin care products, and written hundreds of articles covering the beauty space, from pieces about the trendiest launches to roundups of the best products on the market. As a Korean-American, she grew up in a sea of Korean makeup and skin care products and is a bona fide expert on the ever-expanding world of K-beauty, helping lead our coverage. Additionally, she’s also always on the hunt for the perfect lipstick and watches the same few comfort sitcoms (Frasier, Cheers, Seinfeld, New Girl, etc.) over and over again.
html:
1

Best for a Full Face

Hourglass The Full Face Edit Set

Cons
  • May not be suitable for every skin tone

Hourglass’s holiday gift set is truly a treat. It comes with five full-size hero products, including glitter eyeshadow, an all-purpose face brush, and one of the Ambient Lighting Unlocked Palettes the brand debuted earlier this year. Also included is a large makeup bag to hold all the products and the rest of your everyday makeup routine.

Includes: Face palette, face brush, mascara, single eyeshadow, makeup bag

Value: $333

Nordstrom rating: 4.3/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “Hourglass is hands down one of my top makeup brands of all time. Every single formula I’ve tried from its collections has become a fast favorite, and I’m always excited to see the brand’s new holiday palettes each year. When used together, all of the shades melt into the skin and give it a soft, glowy finish that looks like a real-life filter. Another standout in this kit is the glitter eyeshadow. I don’t think I’ve ever not gotten a compliment while wearing one of the shades. Plus, considering the chic faux-leather makeup bag that comes with this set, I may just have to gift one to myself.”—Carol Lee, ELLE.com associate beauty e-commerce writer

2

Best Lipstick Set

Merit The Dress Code Set

Cons
  • Shades are limited-edition

Merit lipstick enthusiasts, listen up! This set includes three new limited-edition shades and a limited-edition formula meant to tint your lips with a wash of color. The other lipsticks have a nourishing satin finish and a soft matte one in gorgeous hues great for fall, the holidays, and beyond.

Includes: 3 lipsticks

Value: $76

An ELLE editor says: “If I could only wear one brand of lipstick for the rest of my life, it would be Merit. The formulas are exactly what I want them to be (nourishing, non-drying, the perfect balance of pigment), and it’s like Merit pulled the shades right off of a ‘90s Pinterest board. This set has been calling my name since the first time I saw it, and the fact that it includes a new formula and shade is the cherry on top.”—Carol Lee

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

3

Best Luxury

Dior Lip and Cheek Pink Glow Ritual Set

Pros
  • Contains two full-size products
Cons
  • Only one shade option

In case you missed it, TikTok has helped make Dior’s Addict Lip Glow Oil and Rosy Glow Blush two of the most covetable luxury makeup items on the market. This set features both of the viral products and a Dior makeup bag—who could resist?

Includes: Blush, lip oil

Sephora rating: 3/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “If I wanted to introduce someone to the magic of Dior makeup, this set would be my pick. It contains two of the most popular products, and both formulas have blown me away in the past. The bright pink blush transforms into a flattering flush on my cheeks, while the lip oil feels so plush on my lips and makes my pout look as juicy as a peach.”—Carol Lee

4

Best TikTok-Famous

Charlotte Tilbury Pillow Talk Lip and Cheek Secrets Set

Pros
  • Products are cruelty-free
Cons
  • Only one full-size item

Whether you’ve been curious about these products or want a travel-sized version to take with you on your adventures, this makeup set is an ideal opportunity to try a few viral products from Charlotte Tilbury. Apply all of them at once, and you’ll end up with a glamorous, high-shine finish nobody will be able to look away from.

Includes: Travel-size bronzer, travel-size highlighter, travel-size lipstick, lip gloss

Value: $75

Sephora rating: 3.3/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “I have to admit that I totally bought into the hype of Charlotte Tilbury’s Pillow Talk range—and I’m glad I did. Every time I wear the products, I feel like they help me create a look fit for a sexy yet demure princess. The Beauty Light Wands, in particular, have lived up to their reputation—they blend in like a dream and make my cheeks look incredibly glowy under all lighting conditions.”—Carol Lee

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

5

Best Lip Oil Set

Saie Glossybounce Lip Gloss Oil Duo

Cons
  • Shades may not appear as pigmented on all skin tones

We all know and love Saie for its nourishing, high-performance products, and the Glossybounce Lip Gloss Oil is a true winner. Each tube has an infusion of hyaluronic acid, jojoba oil, and shea butter to moisturize and plump your pout. This set includes fan-favorite shade Kiss, a pinky nude, and a new limited-edition one called Crush, a bright blue-red.

Includes: 2 lip oils

Value: $44

An ELLE editor says: “I’ve spoken about this a million times by now, but my one true makeup nemesis is a sticky, gooey lip gloss. I just can’t stand the sensation. Even if they look incredible, I find myself wiping sticky lip glosses off after a few tortured minutes. Discovering the lip oil from Saie was a huge relief because it feels like a nourishing, non-sticky lip balm, but it shines like a gloss.”—Carol Lee

6

Best Lip Gloss Set

Fenty Beauty by Rihanna The Gloss Bomb Vault

Pros
  • Includes a variety of gloss formulas
Cons
  • Some may dislike scent

This option from Fenty features ten gorgeous shades of one of the brand’s most beloved products, the Gloss Bomb, in three different formulas: Universal Lip Luminizer, Heat Universal Lip Luminizer + Plumper, and Ice Cooling Lip Luminizer. It’s a mix of classic tried-and-true hues and new ones that you can only get in this set. If you haven’t tried any of Fenty’s glosses or only have the original, Fenty Glow, this may be your sign to splurge and try the many other shades the brand offers.

Includes: 10 lip glosses

Value: $235

An ELLE editor says: “Fenty’s lip glosses were one of the first non-drugstore options I ever tried and fell in love with. I’m still mesmerized by just how shiny my lips look when I have one on that I swear that I can almost see my reflection in them.”—Carol Lee

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

7

Best Makeup Pencil Set

Make Up For Ever Mini Artist Color Pencil Lipliner & Eyeliner Kit

Pros
  • Pencils are long-lasting
Cons
  • Does not include sharpener

The beauty of Make Up For Ever’s Artist Color Pencils is that you can pretty much use them anywhere on your face, including your eyes and your lips. In a pinch, you can even contour or add some color to your cheeks and eyes with them. This set has five mini versions you can slip into your purse for when you’re on-the-go so you’ll always be prepared.

Includes: 5 mini lip and eye pencils

Value: $60

Sephora rating: 5/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “If you have as many lip liners as I do, it takes a while to get through one. But even if you don’t these will last you a while because they’re so long-lasting and a little goes a long way. Waxier formulas like this one have a tenacity that softer formulas sometimes don’t have, and Make Up For Ever lip liners have stuck with me through 12-hour work days, greasy meals, and countless sips of water.”—Carol Lee

8

Best Setting Spray Value Set

Urban Decay Seeing Double All Nighter Waterproof Setting Spray

The holidays are always the best time to stock up on this crowd pleasing product, which has been a classic for years. It’s a tried-and-true product that paved the way for the setting spray category and significantly extends the weartime of your makeup for up to 16 hours.

Includes: 2 setting sprays

Value: $72

An ELLE editor says: “I’m not the biggest setting spray girl, but when I’m facing an especially humid day or anticipating a special occasion that involves lots of pictures, I rely on this one to keep everything in place. I think I’ve had at least one bottle in my stash for about a decade now.”—Carol Lee

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

9

Best Clean Makeup Set

Iris & Romeo Signature Glow Essentials

Loved ones who are especially ingredient-conscious will appreciate this set from Iris & Romeo, which formulates its high-performing cosmetics without any of the thousands of ingredients banned by the stricter European Union guidelines. The set includes a full-size tinted SPF, a ceramide-infused tint for lips and cheeks, and a curling and volumizing mascara that boosts lash health using peptides.

Includes: Tinted SPF, lip and cheek balm, mini mascara, makeup bag

Value: $94

An ELLE editor says: “If I were to only wear three makeup products, they’d be mascara, eyebrow pencil, and concealer. And I wear quite a lot of mascara—I’m talking three to five layers every time I apply makeup. In my eyes, lashes should be lengthened, curled, and beefed up as much as possible, and the darker the mascara, the better. Brown mascara may be trending these days, but as someone with naturally black hair, I can’t give up my deep black mascara. Iris & Romeo’s signature mascara is currently my absolute favorite because it fits all of my criteria, and it doesn’t smudge all over my under eyes, either. The brush wand curls my lashes sans lash curler, and the formula builds upon itself to give me falsie-like lashes that attract compliments wherever I go. While I haven’t tried the brand’s other products, the mascara is so good that I’m eager to try the rest of the line, and so I might just have to purchase this set for my own stocking.”

10

Best Mini Cheek Set

Rare Beauty Mini Blush and Luminize Trio

Whether you’re a Rare Beauty collector or have yet to dip your toe into the world of Selena Gomez’s beauty line, this mini set is here to introduce you to two never-before-seen cheek shades: a Positive Light Liquid Luminizer in the exclusive shade Enliven, a peachy shade with gold shimmer, and Beloved, a soft brick red. You’ll also find Virtue, a popular neutral peach blush, in the box. A little truly goes a long way with these gems, so even the mini sizes will last you much longer than you think.

Includes: Liquid highlighter, 2 mini blushes

Value: $44

Sephora rating: 4.7/5 stars

A Sephora reviewer says: “This was my first attempt at Rare blushes, and I’m loving the quality. First of all, these colors are perfect for my medium/tan skin tone, adding an interesting touch that lights up any makeup. Also, although these are mini versions, I feel there’s a nice amount of product in them. I would recommend 100 percent.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

11

Best Primer Set

Milk Makeup Mini Hydro Grip Primer Pre-Game Pack Set

Recently, Milk Makeup’s viral Hydro Grip Primer welcomed a new sibling; just like its predecessor, the Hydro Grip + Glow Primer helps makeup adhere to the face and lock in place, but it also bestows upon the skin a sheer golden glow. Want to try both? You’re in luck—this set comes with a mini version of each version, so you can have each one on hand while you decide on which one you like best.

Includes: 2 mini primers

Value: $40

Sephora rating: 5/5 stars

A Sephora reviewer says: “I could not wait to get to try these primers. They both work fantastic.”

12

Best Lip Combo

Refy Plum Lip Liner and Gloss Collection

Move over, Coca-Cola lips—it’s time for juicy plum pouts to shine. Refy has debuted a limited-edition lip duo that fits perfectly with both our moody fall and festive holiday mood boards. Wear the liner on its own for a blurred, matte finish or add the lip gloss on top to make your lips resemble the most stunning stained glass.

Includes: Lip liner, lip gloss

Value: $44

Sephora rating: 4.3/5 stars

A Sephora reviewer says: “This combo is *stellar*! The plum is a perfect fall color. The blur liner is so easy to use, and the gloss has great pigment and is not sticky. So good!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

13

Best Eyeshadow Palette

Danessa Myricks Beauty Lightwork VI The Freedom Palette

Pros
  • Compatible with all other Danessa Myricks palettes
Cons
  • One reviewer noted that a pan fell out on its own

As you can see, this product is basically three palettes in one and contains all of the metallic, shimmery, and duo-chrome shades you might ever need. Here’s a little secret: The magnetic label on the cover of the palette has a mirror on the other side. Plus, you can remove one of the three mini palettes inside the larger case and place the label on top to just take one section with you while traveling. As if that wasn’t enough, the pans are compatible with the brand’s other square-pan palettes, so you can switch out some of the shades as needed. Danessa Myricks never ceases to amaze us.

Includes: 18-pan palette

Sephora rating: 4.8/5 stars

A Sephora reviewer says: “This palette is so much fun. The images online don’t do it justice. Even in the pan, you don’t always see how multi-dimensional these shadows are. On the eyes? Gorgeous! I’m having so much fun playing with this palette. The actual functionality of the palette is so cool, too. Love that you can change the size and configuration.”

14

Best Tinted Lip Balm Set

Summer Fridays The Holiday Lip Butter Balm Set

Pros
  • Curved applicator hugs lips
Cons
  • Some may dislike scents

Summer Fridays’s lip balms are social media-famous for a reason—their seed butter-rich formulas instantly cure flakiness and dryness, and they come in a variety of flattering shades. This trio has clear, pink, and red lip butters. If you look at the price of the set, you’re “basically getting a balm for free,” as one reviewer pointed out.

Includes: 3 lip balms

Value: $72

Sephora rating: 5/5 stars

A Sephora reviewer says: “I was on the fence because I own so many lip things at the moment. Just add it to your cart, because it’s so worth it. I love all the scents, and you are getting so much. It will last you awhile. Treat yourself.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Why Trust ELLE Beauty

As a leading publisher of fashion, lifestyle, and beauty content, ELLE.com is committed to highlighting the best products in various categories by personally testing the latest and most innovative products, interviewing countless experts, and vetting customer-loved items. For this piece, beauty writer Carol Lee combed through the internet for top-rated options for makeup gift sets, assessing each one based on their features and customer evaluations.

Carol Lee is the Associate Beauty E-Commerce Writer at ELLE.com, where she covers all things beauty and personal care. Before joining the team, she was an editor at Food Network Magazine and HGTV Magazine and ran the beauty section at The Pioneer Woman. Carol received her bachelor’s degree in Journalism from New York University and was one of the first customers to visit Glossier’s flagship store in New York’s Soho neighborhood. Over the years, she’s tested countless makeup, hair, and skin care products, and written hundreds of articles covering the beauty space, from pieces about the trendiest launches to roundups of the best products on the market. As a Korean-American, she grew up in a sea of Korean makeup and skin care products and is a bona fide expert on the ever-expanding world of K-beauty, helping lead our coverage. Additionally, she’s also always on the hunt for the perfect lipstick and watches the same few comfort sitcoms (Frasier, Cheers, Seinfeld, New Girl, etc.) over and over again.
